Assistant Accountant

Company Name Galvin-Rowley Executive Search Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 536 views

Job description

As part of a small high-performing team, this newly created role of Assistant Accountant will appeal to a talented and high energy, Graduate Accountant with 2-3 years industry experience either in FMCG/Food Manufacturing or similar.\xa0 A beautiful brand in the health and well being category, this is an exciting career opportunity to accelerate your career and join a privately owned, fast-moving company experiencing strong international growth in particular into China.\xa0\xa0


Located in Melbourne S/E you will be responsible for a broad range of activities including assisting in end to end, full function of Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Banking, Fixed Assets and Payroll. This role will be work across two sites (both Mount Waverley and Rowville) but primarily located in Rowville.\xa0 \xa0 Key duties and responsibilities will include:


● \xa0 \xa0 Payroll

○ \xa0 \xa0 Process payroll and maintain personnel records and organisational chart

○ \xa0 \xa0 Assist in preparation of employment contracts and new employee basic induction

○ \xa0 \xa0 Assist in preparation of payroll reports and payroll reconciliation

○ \xa0 \xa0 Assist in WorkCover claims and preparation of annual return

\xa0

● \xa0 \xa0 Finance

○ \xa0 \xa0 Assist with bank receipts and payments, including payment allocation and bank reconciliation

○ \xa0 \xa0 Assist with Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable function, including entering customer claims and credits and entering suppliers’ invoices

○ \xa0 \xa0 Assist in processing month-end accruals and prepayments and other journals as required

○ \xa0 \xa0 Support the production of the monthly Profit & Loss and Balance Sheet

○ \xa0 \xa0 Assist with cash flow management and forecasting

○ \xa0 \xa0 Assist with monthly reconciliation of General Ledger accounts

○ \xa0 \xa0 Assist with preparation and submission of tax accounting functions including accounting for GST and preparation of BAS statements, FBT, PAYG and Payroll Tax returns


Skills and Qualifications

● \xa0 \xa0 Qualifications

○ \xa0 \xa0 Accounting degree from a tertiary institution

○ \xa0 \xa0 Ideally studying towards CA/CPA qualification

● \xa0 \xa0 Experience

○ \xa0 \xa0 Previous experience in a similar role, with exposure to payroll

○ \xa0 \xa0 High level organisation skills, and an ability to prioritise

○ \xa0 \xa0 Management of processes and procedures

● \xa0 \xa0 General competencies

○ \xa0 \xa0 High levels of initiative with ability to deal with multiple projects simultaneously with conflicting priorities and ability to troubleshoot hardware and software issues

○ \xa0 \xa0 Well established verbal and written communication, high level of attention to detail, problem solving and solutions focused, excellent computer skills and proficient in excel, word and outlook

○ \xa0 \xa0 Collecting, analysing and organising information, communicating ideas and information, planning and organising, solving problems, using technology

\xa0

Attitudes & values

o \xa0 Communicates effectively and treats people with respect

o \xa0 Strong attention to detail and accuracy in quality of work

o \xa0 Demonstrates a willingness to learn and follow work directions efficiently

o \xa0 Shows a can do attitude and uses own initiative

o \xa0 Is a team player who assists others and is cooperative in day to day activities

o \xa0 Ensures high level of productivity, work knowledge and reliability

\xa0

849998622:
[

Project Manager - Data Management

Company Name DFP Recruitment Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 93 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Opportunity


This federal agency is embarking on a large scale and highly complex ITC program of work. Due to this program there is an opportunity for an experienced project manager to assist with various end to end projects across data products and services.


Each Project Manager will be expected to operate as part of the team of Project Managers within the ROBUST program and adhere to a common project framework, including standard approaches to scheduling, finances and planning. Within the role there will be flexibility to influence those frameworks and utilise their expertise to enhance the overall outcomes of the program.


The position is a casual role (no paid leave), until 30th June 2019 with extensions up to 2 years.


Key Deliverables


Project Managers will work with the Program Manager to plan and develop detailed documentation for the delivery of each project. Project Managers will also take responsibility for the delivery of their assigned projects.


The program delivery office will provide the program framework consisting of processes such as finance, methods, risk, organisation change management and communications. The role will be expected to be able to interact effectively across a diverse range of skillsets including ICT experts, policy development, technical writing, procurement and PMO functions.


Core tasks include:

  • Deliver the project scope within approved budget and schedule and agreed quality standard
  • Ensure requirements are clear and the overall solution meets requirements
  • Manage and direct assigned project resources
  • Manage vendors to ensure quality and timely delivery
  • Manage project schedule, risks, issues, assumptions and dependencies
  • Regularly engage with project stakeholders to communicate project status
  • Escalate issues and concerns to the Program Manager.


Required Experience and Skills


Candidates must be Australian Citizens to be considered and will be required to re activate and or obtain a baseline security clearance.

To be successful in the role the Project Manager must be able to meet deadlines, sustain high quality outputs, marshal broad expertise towards common outcome, and have a meticulous approach to project documentation and standards.

Essential skills and experience

  • Candidates are expected to have worked within similarly large, complex programs of work, have relevant experience as a Project Manager and have a proven track record of delivering under deadlines and amongst broad stakeholder groups.
  • Previous project management roles in both the establishment and delivery phases of multi-year technology refresh and/or transformation programs;
  • Demonstrated achievement of project delivery, managing scope, budget, schedule and expectations in projects valued at more than $10m;
  • Proven project delivery capability including overseeing multiple concurrent service providers and customer implementation teams;
  • Demonstrated experience working with technically complex projects involving high volume transactions, very large data sets and the integration of multiple technologies; and
  • Excellent technical domain knowledge.


Nice-to-have skills and experience


Project management of:

  • Large scale Data conversion / migration projects
  • Delivering new Data Management Platform(s)
  • Implementation of new enterprise data processes and services, including data governance framework(s)
  • Establishing Data Analytics centres of excellence
  • Knowledge of data concepts relating to any of the following would be beneficial: Geospatial, Gridded, Time-series Data
  • Knowledge of data methodologies such as DMBOK would be beneficial


To Apply

Please submit your resume in WORD format to be considered - please note your CV must have evidence of the required experience detailed in this ad to be considered. For further information please contact Claire or Jane at DFP on 8632 9900.

[

Naturopathic Customer Service Advisor (12 month contract)

Company Name Swisse Wellness Company Location Collingwood

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 60 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Longing for a career, not a job, working with a team of people who are dedicated to creating premium quality, scientifically validated natural health products and love making people healthier and happier?


Swisse Wellness could be it!


With over 40 years' experience in the Wellness sector, we are a leading Wellness brand in Australia who currently employee over 300 team members globally. From our vitamins and supplements, to our superfoods, sports nutrition and skincare ranges, when you work for Swisse, you are working across multiple wellness categories, full of premium quality products all formulated to help our customers "Celebrate Life Every Day"!


Our people are the reason we succeed. That’s why they’re our first priority. This informs our culture which is grounded in the belief that if we focus on\xa0PEOPLE,\xa0PRINCIPLES\xa0and\xa0PASSION,\xa0then\xa0PROFIT\xa0will naturally follow.


Our team members love the on-site gym, daily meditation class, flexible working hours, provided team lunches, breakfasts and healthy snacks, ‘CLED’ card rewards, global career opportunities and so much more!


Learn more about life at Swisse on our\xa0LinkedIn Page.


THE ROLE:


This role uses expert naturopathic knowledge to ensure that both customers and Swisse team members are being given consistent, timely and professional communication.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Provision of prompt, accurate and professional information to customers utilising expert Naturopathic qualifications
  • Applying Health Science degree knowledge to be proficient at pharmacovigilance
  • Conduct internal Naturopathic health consultations
  • Develop, manage and improve Standard Operational Procedures (SOP) to ensure consistent functioning of the customer service team and inter-team processes
  • Develop, implement and review customer service-based projects
  • Use expert Naturopathic knowledge to contribute to projects conducted by other teams
  • Answering customer queries internally (telephone, emails & social media) and externally (e.g. conferences/seminars) in a timely, professional and welcoming manner
  • Ensure timely and accurate documentation of all customer queries on to the Swisse database, in accordance with the company's written procedures and regulatory requirements
  • Provide support to the wider business, such as Regulatory and Science, New Product Development, Quality Assurance, Sales, Marketing and Office Support teams
  • Communicate Swisse brand by embracing and embodying Swisse culture
  • Contribute to internal and external technical writing such as Standard Operational Procedures (SOP), standard consumer responses, consumer health and product communication

EXPERIENCE\xa0AND SKILLS:


  • A minimum qualification of Bachelor of Health Science degree in Naturopathy
  • Comprehensive knowledge of nutrients and herbal ingredients
  • Minimum 2 years customer service, retail or related experience, especially in communicating therapeutic product information
  • Outstanding interpersonal and strong communication skills to build and maintain relationships with customers and consumers
  • Must be able to demonstrate initiative, precise attention to detail and have the ability to multi-task under challenging conditions
  • Ability to work efficiently within a team environment with a collaborative and proactive approach.
  • Effective time management skills
  • Willing to learn and grow within the company
  • You must have a positive outlook, be reliable with a dedicated work ethic
  • Be accountable and responsible for performance and improvement
  • Implement and promote the Swisse 4P culture and pledge for benchmark standards

Of vital importance is that you will be a solutions-orientated and self-motivated person who will possess an abundance of positivity, initiative and a passion for making People Healthier and Happier as well as demonstrate Swisse Wellness Team Spirit to "Celebrate Life Every Day!


Does this role sound perfect for you? If so, please 'Apply Now' by submitting your cover letter and CV to the Swisse team.

Seniority Level

Entry level

Industry

  • Health, Wellness and Fitness
  • Consumer Goods
  • Pharmaceuticals

Employment Type

Contract

Job Functions

  • Customer Service
  • Sales

[

Associate Partner - McKinsey Implementation

Company Name McKinsey & Company Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 231 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Apply Now

Qualifications
  • Advanced degree, preferably an MBA or Master’s degree in a relevant field
  • 8+ years of work experience after graduate school, with a distinctive record of professional achievement and impact; Previous experience at a tier-one consulting firm preferred
  • Proven track record of developing new client relationships and generating business development opportunities that leads to successful client engagements
  • Experience leading cross-functional teams, and in-depth of knowledge/defined involvement in helping frame, design and execute solutions for challenging business situations
  • Team-orientation and collaborative approach; outstanding listening skills and the ability to manage through influence
  • Proven thought leadership within your industry space including production, syndication/publication of “marketable” knowledge
  • Exceptional intellectual and analytical curiosity, a creative visionary who can manage innovation
  • Sophisticated executive demeanor, comfortable functioning at the highest levels of client organizations; excellent presentation skills, including strong verbal and writing capabilities
  • Seasoned leader/director with strong entrepreneurial drive, who thrives on intellectual challenge and “raises the bar” in terms of client service delivery
  • Demonstrated track record in building client capabilities, delivering results, and seeing a lasting impact
  • Functional skills which lead quickly to client impact, e.g., maintenance, lean operations, Six Sigma, kaizen, procurement, banking/retail operations, sales and marketing, organisational change.
Who You'll Work With

You will be based in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth and will be a part of McKinsey Implementation (MI).

McKinsey Implementation is aligned with, and complementary to our traditional consulting services. From our first involvement in a project, the implementation team is on the ground, ensuring that implementation and success is a priority. We engage at a deep level across our clients’ businesses, working in small teams to build the capabilities, systems, and processes needed to deliver bottom-line results with an aim to ensure those results will be sustained. Our work is about coaching and delivering lasting outcomes.

MI consultants are practical, experienced and great coaches. Their distinctive strength is in knowing how to work with and coach people to get things done. Traits which lead to success in our team include passion, commitment, open-minded-ness, listening skills, humility, and the desire to see others succeed
What You'll Do

You will leverage your successful track record of high-impact client service to strengthen and expand our impact through projects and client development, specifically for McKinsey Implementation.

In this role you will consult existing client service teams as well as top managers at client organizations, and with your sound expertise you’ll provide leadership and direction. Within the firm, you’ll be an entrepreneur who reinvents McKinsey and opens up new opportunities for client impact. You’ll be a mentor and an advisor to developing consultants.

Additionally, as a member of McKinsey’s global network, you will integrate insights from internal and external specialists as well as develop world-class knowledge. You will be an important source of intellectual insight on a client project, framing business problems in a way that the team can then execute to drive impact and client value.

You will be responsible for identifying and developing new client opportunities you will advise companies on transformational change and capability building, leading confirmed project teams on day-to-day problem solving, team management, and client management, and bringing in deep functional knowledge, expertise, and proprietary tools to every client situation.

You will also manage and develop strategic client relationships while ensuring the highest quality client work and be an inspiring leader who commits time to developing new consulting staff.

Seniority Level

Executive

Industry

  • Management Consulting

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Consulting
]

Front End Developer - Web Analytics

Company Name Data Runs Deep Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 40 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Front End Developer - Web Analytics


  • Australia’s nicest Google Analytics 360 specialist, slap bang in the middle of Melbourne

  • Awesome clients, and a uniquely supportive working environment

  • Finish work at 4:30 pm every. single. day!


We are looking for a technical minded front-end developer with solid Javascript skills, and a passion for analytics and data -- ideally with a bit of experience in analytics and tag management.


A new role sitting alongside our current technical team and providing support to development and analysis teams.



About the Role

  • Implementation & Solutions Design

    • Implement tracking for Google Analytics, primarily through Google Tag Manager

    • Documenting solutions and implementation specifications as guided by senior technical members

    • Testing and debugging

    • Mobile tracking and other similar technology experience are nice to have


  • Audit & QA

    • Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager audits (training will be provided)

    • Account setup and optimisation (e.g. Container cleanup, best practices)

    • Helping clients and coworkers solve problems


  • Other

    • Heaps of learning and training from the best people in the business

    • Paid R&D time to work on funky stuff

    • Potential interstate travel


What we offer

  • Permanent, full-time position with a salary in the range of $75,000-$85,000 including superannuation, based on experience and reviewed at six months

  • Hours are generally 08:30 – 16:30 and we hardly if ever work late

  • Formal hours-in-lieu policy; if you work late (includes evening meetups etc) you come in late the next day

  • Based CBD, Potential to work remotely and have flexible hours

  • Subsidised travel to conferences

  • Four weeks’ leave, plus your birthday off

  • Paid days Research & Development to work on a project of your choosing every month

  • One dollar per day donated to a homelessness charity on your behalf

  • Training from some of the best in the business

  • An extremely lovely office environment

  • Access to the Beta programs by Google and monthly heads up for what’s in store



About Data Runs Deep


Data Runs Deep is a Melbourne-based Google Analytics specialist and Google Analytics 360 Reseller.


Our stated goal is to be the nicest person that the person you’re speaking to has spoken to all day. Everything else is an elegant charade (albeit a fun one.)


We have a varied and fun client base that doesn’t include anyone in a nasty industry. We walk the talk on work-life balance, with a 4:30pm finish every day to get a head start on your commute. Our office is next to the Block Arcade in the heart of marvellous Melbourne.



Interested?

Apply on LinkedIn, or email careers@datarunsdeep.com.au

You will love the modern offices that are bustling with energy. Every day is different and there is never a dull moment. What is really great about this role are the career progression opportunities.


Here's why you will love this!
You will be part of a high performing and self-managing merchandise team. In this role, you will work together to deliver the departmental KPI's.
